Reviews.Title: “Great views and location”
Reviews.Author: JAMZTOWN
Reviews.Content: Great views of the Golden horn and great location. Kind of hard to find, but what isn't in Istanbul? Kind of loud but in the three hotels I stayed at in Turkey all 3 had noise issues. Great staff and good transport service.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal...and much more”
Reviews.Author: Aditya K
Reviews.Content: For the kind of budget, it is an excellent place to stay, location is central to the Sultanahmet area which houses most of the historical tourist sites. Rooms are clean and have amazing views of the Marmara sea and a small balcony. Breakfast is heavy and overlooks the sea from the terrace. The hotel has a very homely feel, especially the building A. I had a very nice experience with their staff service, I had lost my phone in an airport shuttle owned by a company right next to the hotel, and they not only went and spoke to the company but actually retrieved the phone for me and arranged for my friend to pick it up from there. It was there goodwill that really struck me apart from all the other qualities the place possesses . One must not expect too much out of the hotel, and treat it more like a holiday home, which is perfect for a decent, comfortable budget stay in Istanbul, which would not disappoint. I would highly recommend this place especially for a quaint, quiet atmosphere. This is one place that makes you feel at home even when travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: The room we had (#16) had sea view and was on the top floor. View was OK, but not worth it as it can be seen from the breakfast room which is next door to this room. Ceiling is low close to the window, but as we are both not tall it was no problem for us. The balcony is also very small and not really practical and private. The worst part for us was the hard noise of the trains coming by all day except from midnight to around 6 in the morning. Next to the noise of the traffic, this gives little time for rest if you come home around or a little after midnight. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Bed was nice. Price felt a bit overpriced to us.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in a basement room”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: This review is about my room stay at Deniz House B, room 12 I believe, and I did not like this room. The hotel is in a great location to check the sights or go out and about. We reserved our room on Agoda, and explicitly requested a non-basement room, but to no avail. I almost bolted when we were shown the room, and asked for any other room, but no go. Grim indeed. But we were leaving for the airport and the long flight home early the next morning, so we gutted it out. The room smelled of must and industrial disinfectant. We climbed on the bed to open the tiny basement window, and went out for a few hours, which freshened the air and made it less tomb-like. There was a tv in the room, but apparently the antenna was not connected to anything that might receive a signal - Our room was right under the front desk, and you could hear every chair scrape, pencil drop, and the comings and goings of all. - The rooftop area looked like it would be nice to hang out in, but it was raining so I don't know for sure. - Left before breakfast, don't know about it. - The hotel offered airport transfers for 15 Euro per person, while right across the street the transfer can be had for 5 Euro. This hotel is probably a fine experience if you are not in the basement - though not a 3 star by other standards - but the room I stayed in was a deal-beaker.

Reviews.Title: “best choice”
Reviews.Author: istanbul2012
Reviews.Content: A very nice, romantic hotel with an extraordinary friendly and professional staff. We were helped with every wish we had. Our baby also felt very comfortable. The breakfast is amazingly fresh and rich, with a fantastic view, including the Marmara Sea. Absolutly best choice we could have made!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy but manage your expectations”
Reviews.Author: GMR83Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last year with my mom and nephew. It's a good value for money -- the location is unbeatable although it is a fairly decent walk uphill to Sultanahmet and Hagia Sophia. The breakfast is good, my mom loved it. Most of the staff were ok and helpful. This remains a 3 star hotel so people need to lower their expectations when it comes to amenities and services.

Reviews.Title: “A great family run hotel close to all the historic sites”
Reviews.Author: Tom62Lancs
Reviews.Content: We visited Deniz Houses hotel in early March for a late winter break in Istanbul, our first visit to the city. Even before we arrived the hotel staff contacted us via email and were extremely helpful with their advice about getting to and from the airport and other services they provided. The hotel is a great family run operation with really friendly front of house staff. The rooms are well appointed with really comfortable beds. We paid extra for rooms with a sea view and this was worth every extra Euro. Breakfast is on the top floor of the hotel with views overlooking the Mamara Sea. The breakfast itself is a really comprehensive mix of cereals, breads, cheese, local pastries and Turkish specialities - something for everyone. If you're looking for a hotel close to the historic sites of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace - you couldn't do better than this one. You're 10 minutes leisurely walk and see the Blue Mosque from the top floor of the hotel. A good, sound hotel that delivers a no nonsense, comfortable stay - offering great value for money and a really warm welcome. We will return to Istanbul and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that treats you like family”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: I received a warm welcome from everyone at this hotel, from the airport transfer people to the front desk receptionists and the breakfast coordinator. Once the seaside home of a well-to-day Turkish family, Deniz Houses hotel is located in the heart of Sultanahment, one of the most tourisity areas of Istanbul. While it is not a luxury hotel, it treats guests like family and is charmingly reflective of Turkish hosptality. The staff are friendly, courteous, efficient and ever ready to help. The rooms are small, but spic and span and on the south side, offer a splendid view of the Sea of Marmora. The complimentary eat-all-you can breakfasts are substantial and are a great way to begin a day of exploring the many attractions of the city. With its affordable prices, it is good value for budget-conscious travellers. Susan Korah, Ottawa, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Location - AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: I found this small hotel very friendly in communication I had with them. They showed up on time at the airport to meet us and we were impressed by the speed we got to the hotel in the minibus. Once checked in, we took a short walk from the hotel and we were impressed by the proximity to the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque. We were literally a stones throw from the Grand Bazaar and we even took a cruise on the Bosphorus. You can't beat this place for location. The rooms are okay, but nothing special, and it was great to enjoy a beer on the roof overlooking the sea. For us, we just used this place as somewhere to sleep, so for that and its proximity to all the big landmarks in Istanbul, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: NellABJ
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at Deniz Houses (we were put in â€œDeniz Houses Bâ€�) for a week and found it to be a great home base for exploring Istanbul. What it might lack in character (and room size!), it makes up for with efficiency and friendliness. For this very touristy area, I think itâ€™s also great value for what you end up getting. There a lot of nice little touches that go above and beyond most budget placesâ€”slippers in the room when you arrive, toiletries, bottles of water, and a cleaning service everyday. The wifi there was very reliable, if not a bit slow at times. We also really enjoyed the rooftop breakfast every morningâ€”there is a great spread of pastries, breads, cheeses, olives, meats, yogurt, cereal, and (our favorite), scalloped potatoes. There is someone at the front desk at all hours of the day and everyone there is remarkably friendly and helpful. It takes less than ten minutes to walk from the Blue Mosque from there and the neighborhood feels very safe and comfortable. I would definitely recommend Deniz Houses if youâ€™re looking for a comfortable stay in Sultanahmet and donâ€™t want to break the bank!

Reviews.Title: “best palce for price”
Reviews.Author: Mahmoud G
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends have best days in istanbul in this hotel adv: 1. the site near sultanahmet and ayasofeya and tokabi palace and metro station 2.very very clean rooms and professional 3.the price was very good 4.the breakfast was nice and i loved the hole day available snacks. 5.just the perfect place for people how want to visit all istanbul and come to the hotel to find a clean room and a good meal in the morning. 6.friendly stuff 7.near Bursa fary station disadv: 1.there is 3 very small rooms try to avoid them (no place fo extra bed) 2.there was somtimes a bad smell in front of the hotel 3.the walls is not sound proof (be carefull ;) )

Reviews.Title: “Lovely People, Sea-View Breakfast, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ElleMoth
Reviews.Content: Deniz Houses is the best value I've found in Sultanahmet. The staff were welcoming, friendly, and professional. The women who orchestrated the cleaning and the breakfast/tea were especially kind. The breakfast is well above average for an Istanbul hotel: they made a delicious scalloped potato and had a good variety of cold selections. Best of all, you can enjoy breakfast or tea with a lovely rooftop view of the Marmara and much of the city (the rooftop is enclosed and heated in winter). 3 p.m. tea on this rooftop was a relaxing and convivial midday break. Rooms were very nice and had nearly everything one could need. The location is excellent. All in all, this is the best value I've found in Sultanahmet. I expected very little for the price, but was surprised to find a dignified small business that clearly takes pride in providing a unique and comfortable service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, absolutely recommended”
Reviews.Author: NoQuarter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the "Deniz Houses" in the "B" building some days ago, and felt totally satisfied with this little hotel. I got 3 stars deluxe quality service at the price of a bed and breakfast. My twin room was large enough for guests with big luggage. Very clean and warm, very enjoyable when coming back from the freezing cold outside. Nice bathroom with large shower and hot water 24/24 (i had a shower at 3 am, no problem). Good genuinely homemade breakfast, will suit all tastes. 3 story bulding with terrace on the higher floor, no lift. Nice street a few steps from kucuk ayasofia cadde, with its restaurants and mini markets. 15 min. walking from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Great. 24/24 reception, staff is friendly and helpful with transfers (recommended), laundry and other facilities. Overall: absolutely recommended for travellers of all budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Opiniona
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in November, the rooms were kept warm and clean. Room size was ok. The staff are very friendly, always eager to help. The breakfast variety was limited. The hotel is very close to the Blue Mosque and Arasta Bazar, the view from the terrace is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Would reccomend”
Reviews.Author: Desliegh
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel, the room we stayed in was lovely, very clean and overlooked a little cobbled street. The reception staff are very helpful. It is a 5 minute walk to all the top attractions. The hotel staff arrange arranged our airport transfers 20 euros each way and complementary water and cake for the journey. Would stay here again as good value for money for a 3 night stay breakfast incuded and transfers 116 euros

Reviews.Title: “Last minute, fast and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Alek2Travel
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotels.com at the last minute. The rooms are reasonable in size and clean. The hotel is walking distance to the main attractions. They have two properties within walking distance from one another. No elevators FYI. Great staff and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent and very reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikesvoice
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished hotel in the old town so access is very limited for anyopne with mobility problems and the doors are extremely low. The hotel itself is beautiful and very very clean, warm in the middle of an istanbul winter and was very cheap. Breakfast is local and of very good quality, tea and cakes are free each day at 3. Bed is about the comfiest ive ever slept in, nice and firm high quality mattress. Al the basics are excellent and I could not fault this place on them. Only niggles i would say is Bath (which i love) had no plugs and hot water appeared limited. Dont let this put you off though because the cleaniliness and comfort more than made up for this. Situation is great Just behind the Blue Mosque in some back streets so you are away fromm the traffic and trams in sultan Ahmet but only a 5 minute walk to the tram and all the sights as well as 2 minutes from the sea front. I nearly forgot to add, the view from the room of the sea was spectacular I could watch the boats enter th Bosphorous all night !!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to Stay when Exploring Istanbul's Sultanahmet District”
Reviews.Author: oci_innkeeper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with my parents, recently traveled to Istanbul. We were there just by chance because of a layover with Turkish Air and decided to make an overnight stay of it. We are so glad we did! Since we were there for such a short time we decided to seek the help of a tour company so that we could see as much of the city as possible. On the recommendation of friends and some internet research we found Backpackers Travel in Sultanahmet-Istanbul. They picked us up at the airport early in the morning, checked our luggage and off we went with our fabulous guide for a whirlwind tour of the city. We started our day with a Turkish coffee in a local cafe, which was a welcome way to start after the 10 hour flight from New York City. Our tour guide spoke flawless English and was obviously very proud of his city and quite knowledgeable of its history. He showed us the Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and the Cistern. We enjoyed a nice kebap lunch, which was included in our tour. We also toured the grand bazaar. My husband was interested in purchasing some carpets so our guide took us to a reputable dealer where we made a purchase after some exciting bargaining over more Turkish coffee. The rugs we purchased were shipped to us. We might have been nervous about such a purchase in a foreign country but felt assured by our guide and are happy to report that the same rugs arrived just one month after our purchase in fine condition. We took the tram to the waterfront where we had hoped to end the day with a cruise but the last ferry had been cancelled so instead we toured the spice market and walked across the bridge for the at sunset before returning back to our hotel. Our stay at Deniz House was quite pleasant. We were more than pleased with the value of the stay for the price we paid. The room was comfortable and clean. The view was lovely. Travelers should be prepared for lots of stairs and shorter door frames and small showers due to the age of the building but we found this all part of the charm of the building and the area. For me the best part of our stay was the beautiful continental breakfast. It was a delightful spread of fruits, olives, breads, boiled eggs, fresh cucumbers and tomatoes as well as a couple of hot dishes that included a delicious potato gratin. The breakfast room is on the top floor of the hotel and has a small terrace which is a great place to take in some coffee while watching the neighborhood wake up. Because of the wonderful information and advise from our tour guide the day before we were able to comfortably explore the city on our own the next day. We enjoyed Topkapi palace and the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Art before leaving that evening for the airport. Backpackers Travel and the Deniz House Hotel made our brief stay in Istanbul comfortable and extraordinarily memorable. i would highly recommend their accommodations and services to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very handy”
Reviews.Author: RonNoosa
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Deniz (B) Houses in Istanbul and was very happy with the accommodation. It is in the Sultanahmet District which meant it was only about a 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. The building is very narrow and has three floors of accommodation, no lift, and a small but attractive roof-top terrace for breakfast which was included in the tariff. Breakfast was adequate and typical European (no bacon & eggs). I paid A$80.00 a night and organised an airport pickup with Backpacker Travel Limo who seem to have a connection with the hotel.The cost was 20 Euro or TL50 and pay the driver on arrival at the hotel. The hotel is difficult to locate for most taxi drivers so locate it on a map to show the driver and write the address down to show them. Free WiFi is available in room but not accessible on the rooftop terrace. Free coffee and snacks are available at 3pm on the terrace which has a good view of the Bospherous.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jayda L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on a city break to istanbul. This hotel was a bargain for the price we paid and the location was great. The room was had was a bit on the small side on the first floor, but this was not a problem. The hotel staff greated us every morning when we came downstairs and the free breakfast was fantastic. Located on a nice little side street away from the hustle and bustle and near to most major attractions. Would return again to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: jinsarn
Reviews.Content: Overall, recent reviews pretty much reflect our stay at Deniz Houses in Jan 2011. We enjoyed our stay there, and recommend it highly. To summarize: Location is excellent -- a pleasant 5 min walk uphill to the Blue Mosque and Hippodrome, yet removed and secluded both from the crowds and bustle of the tourists in Sultanahmet and from the commerce closer to the Grand Bazaar/Beyazit area. Airport transfers were very efficient in large, comfortable vehicles. Staff are very friendly and helpful -- this is the kind of place that is small enough to be personal and warm, and they really do care about you. But is also large enough that they have certain standards and scale economies with the service delivery and sister properties (basically a few small hotels in the vicinity). Rooms were small-ish but comfortable and cosy. We got upgraded to a sea view room, which had great views and a cute balcony. Others have mentioned the noise from passing trains, the tracks are right below. We were not bothered by the noise, the trains don't run from midnight to 6am. There are good quality double glazed windows and the balcony door, to help reduce the noise. But anyone who thinks that this might bother them should probably request a room that does not face the tracks -- the new building, and those rooms in the old building facing the street, would be fine. Heating was more than adequate, we found it too warm despite turning off the radiator, and had the window open a crack. Bathroom was clean and hot water in the shower was great. Bedroom slippers and a small fruit/snack plate over the fridge were nice touches. We found the bed itself a bit hard, and the pillows flat, but slept just fine. Wifi is available throughout, but did not work well from room, they have to sort out one of the routers. Otherwise it worked fine from the terrace area, and also at reception. The old building has the charm of wood and rugs etc. -- we liked that a lot. Breakfast was a very large buffet spread served on the terrace level with great views. The spread was large, and Turkish in character: breads, eggs, honey and jams, olives, cheeses, fruit. Also a hot section with sausages, potatoes, etc. Coffee and tea and some snacks are available all day here also, as is water from water dispenser here and at the reception. Price-wise we found Deniz Houses to be good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend as good budget option”
Reviews.Author: baggard
Reviews.Content: Stayed for long weekend with a small group of friends looking for a not expensive but central hotel. This ticked the boxes. Location very good - 5 mins walk (uphill, not too steep) to the Blue Mosque. Staff friendly, efficient and helpful (although recommendations didn't go beyond the usual tourist places) and the airport pickup they organised for us was good. The hotel is split over 2 buildings and I think which one you end up in will make a difference to how much you enjoy your stay. Essentially the main (original) building where reception is has nicer and more characterful rooms but is the one that is nearer the train tracks. My boyfriend and I paid a little extra from the standard room price for a "garden" room. We ended up in the main building, on the ground floor with a little outdoor private terrace with table and chairs and a swinging "love seat"! Although not high up you could still look over the fence/look from the room window and watch the ships on the sea of marmara. The higher up balcony/sea view rooms were above us and do have a good view - there are better views in istanbul, but all in all the view is lovely. Our room was spacious and light and very nicely decorated with nice dark wood furniture and nice and recent decor, although the shower wasn't very powerful. The train track runs past this building and particularly right outside the "garden" rooms. We didn't have any problems with this - although the trains are loud and we did notice them during the day, they aren't particularly frequent and did stop at a certain time so we slept fine. All in all, very impressed and very happy for the price we paid. My friends who paid the standard room price all ended up in the other building. The rooms are fine there, just not quite as nice/a bit more basic. The decor and linen were not as pretty and the rooms were slightly smaller. However, still a good budget option and no complaints. Two friends with a twin ended up in the triple/quad room in the basement which was a very big room but had no windows and was therefore a bit dingy. On the plus side, the showers in the other building are excellent. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace of both buildings (you can choose, each has its plus points on view) and is reasonably basic but fine. Fresh tea/coffee and lovely pastries are available all day and stocked up regularly :) There is also wifi. Nice white slippers provided in rooms which was a fab surprise :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, great for short-staying budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: puxadoraz
Reviews.Content: Cheap, location is okay, not particularly near a tram but it didn't matter cos we took a taxi. But its near the must-see sights like the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Staff there are incredibly helpful, they allowed us to use their computer, printed our boarding passes for our onward flights and delivered it to our room. Very kind! Climb up to the roof where breakfast is served and you get a view of the mosques, do visit it at night, its beautiful. In the mornings, you will be accompanied by seagulls as you enjoy the modest spread. Rooms are sufficient and utilitarian, but for the price you are paying, it's good value for $$.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zuzana K
Reviews.Content: I spent in Deniz Houses 3 nights. I got amazing, lovely room with small terrase only for me. Room has really nice and clean bathroom with big-space shower and pleasant hot water. Temperature of room was perfect. And breakfast was delicious. I booked single room, but when my boyfriend came to Istanbul to suprise me, in hotel give us really low price for second person in the room. Employees were all very nice. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi palace are 5-10 far by walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great! Helpful and Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Morgan M
Reviews.Content: Deniz house you get what you pay for. Staff very friendly and helpful. They went out of there way to show you maps and give directions and advice. 10 min walk from all the big tourist attractions, so great location for the price. Breakfast buffet is typical of most hotels and hostels you stay in while in Turkey. Don't expect North American fare. Rooms cozy and quaint. Slippers were a nice touch. As other posters have mentioned train tracks are nearby and they are active, I heard the trains. Didn't bother my sleep while I was here. So not a deal breaker for me. When I come back to Turkey. I would stay here again and as for the people who have mentioned bedspreads and not clean enough showers.......pfffft the hilton's up the road for an extra 400 euro/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Great Value - Clean and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Dana S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very quaint and is an excellent value. I visited several other hotels in the area and they were either more expensive or of lower quality and value. The staff is extremely helpful. I forgot my camera for an important business excursion and the manager provided me with his own. Anything that i needed they went out of their way to provide, any information that i needed they spent the time with me to provide. The Hotel is very well located, very close to the Blue Mosque and the local restaurants in a quiet street corner. The breakfast was ample, maybe a little variation from day to day would be nice, but most visitors will not stay as many days as i did. The only negative is that some of the center rooms are very small and some of the rooms with the sea view are over the railroad tracks (many hotels in the area also look over the tracks and the trains do not run that often or that late) - for the price - it can not be beat! This hotel is a great value with great service! I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service”
Reviews.Author: PradeepPune_India
Reviews.Content: The people at the reception are so helpful am yet to find anyone like them in the world !! Central, yet a quite location, a short walk from Blue Mosque area in Sultanahmet.Small eateries around. The rooms are neat, housekeepers are quick and the breakfast good. The view from the breakfast room was awesome. Highly recommended to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but could do much better to make this a great property”
Reviews.Author: washingtonDCGreta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Deniz Houses in October and found other similar accommodations in this price range better. The location was decent and convenient. It is very nice that they provide slippers and refridgerators in the rooms. The breakfast was very good and the views from the roof nice. Staff is very friendly! Here were my issues during my stay that I brought to the manager's attention. 1) Floor in the bathroom was not properly cleaned and the shower was very moldy. This could have been easily remedied when I told them this, but they did not bother during my stay. 2) Bedspread was threadbare and dirty. Again no remedy during my stay, but they did give me extra cotton blankets, so I got rid of the bedspread. 3) Reception staff are friendly, but they are misinformed. I needed help with transportation to another part of Turkey. The second one said the their travel agency could help, but they were closed sunday. (they were in fact not, but he did not bother to call to check), The third staff member did not help, nor make a phone call - but gave me the address of their travel agency and told me to walk there. So I walked there and wished I had simply done this two days prior. In the end the travel manager was very savvy and had all the answers, but I don't understand why this connection could not have been made days earler. He listened to my issues, told me he managed the property, and would look into it, but no changes were made. This property would be great if they did the following! Bought new linens and duvets with washable covers cleaned the bathroom floors better bleached away the mold in the shower Informed reception about the travel agency and their phone number They also have great roof patio that they do not make enough use of. More tables, plants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location amazing, but a bit loud - not great for baby”
Reviews.Author: oceanne_11
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing. It was a real pleasure to be near everything with a short walk. Breakfast was fine, although don't expect great coffee (hard to find if you are the typical filter type like me) We had a room in the first floor with a baby and it was LOUD. Not only the staff, but also the other guests. This caused us some difficulty as we were travelling with a baby. I would say it's a good budget place, but not with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accomadation”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Deniz Houses for 5 nights in the middle of August. I chose it because of it's cheap price and the good reviews of tripadvisor and it definitely did not disappoint! The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and their English was perfect. The location was perfect, close to many of the major tourist spots and easy to get the all the other parts of the city. Our room was nice, clean and had everything you would expect (including a fridge, which was very useful). Our room also had a beautiful view over the bospherus and had a teeny tiny balcony, which was extra handy for my boyfriend's occasional cigarette. The breakfast was simple but amazingly tasty! and even though it was the same food every day we never got sick of it, and everything was always fresh and replenished. Free internet was also a major plus, something that is often not included in 4/5* hotels (we stayed at the Movenpick Hotel, Istanbul after this and had to pay an extortionate amount for wi-fi). The only negative point about our stay was that we had requested a double bed before arrival but we were given twin beds. We asked three times for them to change it into a double but in the end we just pushed the beds together ourselves. Anyway, overall it was amazing value for money and a great place to stay while exploring Istanbul. One other point- don't go to the cafe/restaurant next door!! the worst food and service we had ever had in Turkey, and my partner has lived in Istanbul for a year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn K
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Deniz House and are looked forward to our return at the end of our visit to Turkey. The room was nice, clean with comfy beds and warm blankets, the breakfast was varied with some nice extras, the staff are friendly and helpful. The view of the city is enchanting. The air conditioning is quieter than room units in Canada and the train nearby was not an issue. This is a good value hotel in a prime location, they even provide drinking water day and night. J/P Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, 5 mins walk from blue mosque.”
Reviews.Author: BIC1980
Reviews.Content: Helpful with recommendations for entertainment and tickets easily sourced, easy to get taxi to from airport about 35 tl, taxi stand outside the hotel, nice restaurants all around recommend doy doy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Stefan V
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, everything needs a man has it in this hotel. Friendly staff ready to help with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice staff and services”
Reviews.Author: ekhalid
Reviews.Content: Its really a pleasure writing about one of most memorable trip of my life. So i will let you know in details. â€¢ I came to know about Backpackers from one of my friend (Dr.Salman Khokhar). And he was right to recommend it. â€¢ I stayed in Deniz House B, the most nice thing is location which is very close to blue masjid so you can go and pray every day. Other historical places are nearby as well. Nice terrace with morning view of sea and buffet breakfast. â€¢ Hotel rooms are nice with windows towards sea side (its the room i got), with Wi Fi, TV, Fridge. Washrooms are good with daily service and cleaning. â€¢ Local tour services like buses and mini vans are nice and guides have knowledge and historical background and patience for guests (as i was travelling with my 1 year old son). â€¢ Sales team (Backpackers) kept good communication with me and hotel staff to facilitate us fully. I will rate sales team 4.7/5 for their efficiency and communication. Hotel team is very cooperative and helpful so 4.7/5 for them. *There is a recommendation, washrooms are lacking in toilet shower beside commode if those can be installed it would be very nice. I have already recommended it to my colleagues as it is worth value of money you pay or may be more. Dr.Ehtesham Khalid

Reviews.Title: “Charming house with welcoming, helpful staff in spectacular surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Jan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed Deniz Houses for three days in late September 2011 and recommend it unreservedly. It is a most charming house with an air of family business about it. The staff were so unfailingly welcoming and helpful that we felt immediately at home. Our room was located on the ground floor and had a terrace with a small, but quite beautiful garden - an unexpected treat in the middle of a busy metropolis. After having explored the surrounding quarters and their famous sights we very much enjoyed sitting on the terrace in the shadow of the fruit trees and gazing contentedly on the Marmara Sea. Or later on watching the passing ships and seagulls in the moonlight. The railroad tracks that run between the hotel and the sea did not bother us in the least, even though we slept with the windows wide open. We will certainly return to Istanbul some day to see more of the city and when we do, we would like to stay in Deniz Houses again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ruth C
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but clean and very conveniently located near Sultanahmet Square. Personable staff and a great breadkast buffet on a top floor garden. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “such helpful and kind staff..”
Reviews.Author: gabriella s
Reviews.Content: This July my daughter and I spent 3 days in this delightful hotel, very conveniently placed by the Blue Mosque in a tranquil area with splendid views on the Bosforus. The personnel was exceptionally kind and so helpful in helping us to solve various problems including backing up our precious photos otherwise destined to be lost forever (and with them the souvenir of this wonderful town). Thank you so much to the manager Mr Kereu and to Ms Asli! Most recommended. We'll certainly come back to spend a few more days.... Gabriella and Alba from Monza (Italy)

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: yupingg
Reviews.Content: The company runs three hotels: Sultanâ€™s Inn, Deniz House and Naz Wooden House Inn. Itâ€™s rather a commercial chain than a boutique hotel. The management, the rooms and the services, everything reminds me the business hotel chains in US. Cold and very business oriented. The worse is that they switch guests around different hotels to fill the capacity. Smart idea, but think about when you are exhausted from a long flight, after walking around all the narrow and dusty streets finally you saw the sign of the hotel on your reservation email. You walked in, but the guy at the reception told you "we are full. You have to go to another one which is our sister hotel." This was what exactly happened to me. Actually even worse. I stayed in Istanbul for three days and then took a tour to Cappadocia and came back to Istanbul to fly back to the US. The day before I left Istanbul to Cappadocia , since I knew I'll have a late arrival when I came back, I walked to the hotel to get myself familiar with the location. When I tried to confirm my reservation with the guy sitting at the reception desk, he told me my reservation was with The Naz Wooden House. I showed him my email confirmation from Deniz House but he insisted that in the system my reservation was with the other hotel. I gave up and walked back to the Naz Wooden House and confirmed my reservation and also booked the airport transfer from them. But at the night when I came back from Cappadocia, when the driver dropped me at the Naz Wooden House, the reception told me "We are full." It was almost middle night and I was already exhausted. After the very unpleasant discussion with the reception and the guy at the reservation, both of them were very rude and stubborn, I completely lost my energy. I wanted to call the hotel I stayed before to check if they have any rooms. When I asked the reception if I can use the phone on the desk, he only gave me two words, â€œTwo Euro.â€� During the trip in Turkey, I have met so many nice local people who were willing to call from their own cell phone to help me out. I asked if I can cancel my reservation. They told me no. I had to pay the first night anyway and I can go for the second night for free. At that moment I just wanted to throw myself on a bed. The driver was actually quite nice. He dropped me at another hotle and asked me to talk to the management the next day. The window of the room I stayed (No. 10) was facing a very busy street and also the TRAM (their local light rail). Very loud. I dreamed I was sitting on the train going somewhere at night. The next day, I went to see the management. They told me I had to pay half of the second day if I moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Nirzari D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and all the staff was excellent and very helpful. Fatih was the staff at reception and he helped us with information on local places. Our bookings and also guided on places to eat and see. Breakfast was good everyday and rooms althouh small were clean and with all facilities. The best part of the places was staff. Asli was one of the staff who was also very nice and helpful won't our accommodation and Also our requirements

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Erlinda Y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our 2 adult sons stayed in 2 rooms in Deniz House # 2 for 8 nights in 9/9/11. I was pleasantly surprise by the hotel. It is a very clean hotel, located in a nice and safe location. All staff from reception to the breakfast cook, to the housekeeping ladies all greets you with a big smile and always ready to help you with all your needs. All reception staff speak English well and keep offering to help book your trip or whatever your needs are. With the traffic in Sultanamet area, Deniz House is a walking distance to all the historical sites. And the breakfast terrace, it has the most beautiful view of the sea of Marmara and the Blue mosque and very good and excellent breakfast. I will definitely be coming back and will definitely return to stay at the Deniz Houses. I highly recommend Deniz Houses to all my friends, it is the best place to stay in Instanbul without breaking your bank account. Erlinda

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Puppy22
Reviews.Content: It's not always easy to find a good value hotel in Sultanahmet, we found that Deniz Houses offered just that, along with helpful staff, clean rooms, free internet access and water. A solid budget hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: LucyPie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights during a 3 week trip to Turkey. The staff was most helpful, the hotel is in a good location, breakfast was bountiful (speak to the lady cook in Turkish, it makes her smile), beds were comfy, and the room was spacious. We were in a room on the 3rd floor overlooking the Marmara Sea - room 13? With a little balcony. Nice room. The train goes by right under those windows, though, as does traffic on a main road. If you are a light sleeper, it might annoy you. It did not annoy me. Location wise you are about a 12 minute walk (mostly up hill) to the Blue Mosque, a few minutes further to the Hagia Sophia and other attractions. We happily walked all over the Sultanahmet neighborhood from the hotel. Never felt uncomfortable (except from the marketing efforts of vendors) - lots of people on the streets. We would recommend the Deniz House.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, will be back”
Reviews.Author: tamara s
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay, clean, safe, all the staff was friendly and helpful. The choices at breakfast were great. Nice rooftop setting. Close to all the historical sites so you can walk of you dont want to take a tour. I can't say enough about what a nice place this was for the money and how nice and helpful the staff was.

Reviews.Title: “The most homelike hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Otilia1471
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Istanbul with my daughter for 7 nights.The staff at the hotel is very kind and friendly, they help you in any problem. The location is great and you have two beautiful views from the terrace (Blue Mosque and the Marmara Sea). The breakfast was excellent, with a lot of dishes. The rooms are very clean and they change the laundry every day. I will definitely stay at Deniz Houses if I return to Istanbul! I felt like home there! Congratulations, Deniz Houses!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Quaint, Very Clean and Fantastic Service - We'll definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: RMACH
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely - great location in Sultanahmet - short walking distance to Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Cistern, Grand Bazaar, etc. The staff were so helpful. Its a small hotel - cosy, intimate, friendly. Breakfast at the rooftop terrace was lovely - views across Sultanahmet and Water. Rooms were impeccably clean - not over the top - subtle charm. Close to lovely local Turkish restaurants and small bazaar. We are two adults and two children (11 & 10) and although not too cramped - wouldn't stay too long though as a little on the small size (similar to most hotels across UK/Europe)

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: louisebiscbay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June for a total of about 10days. We stayed for the first week of our vacation, then we came back after going on a side venture to Safranbolu, and then back again after visiting Petra and Wadi Rum in Jordan. We were so happy at Deniz House. I had been communicating by e-mail with Kerem before we got there. I had made our reservation online with him several months prior to our arrival. He was the one who checked us in the night we got there. He took such good care of us, going out of his way to make us comfortable after our long journey from the states. He would always help us with bus tickets and directions to the ferry and tell us how to reach the proper public transportation, restaurant suggestions and many things I don't even remember. The room was perfect: two twin beds with bedside tables and a big cupboard with closet and shelf for your clothes (like a built in armoire). There was a nice small frig in the room and a dressing table. Also a small balcony with table and chairs overlooking the Sea of Marmara. The bathroom was well designed and clean with lots of hot running water. They have the most adorable breakfast room on the top floor where Ayten prepares a fresh breakfast buffet with all sorts of delights every morning. She was so cheerful that even though we didn't speak but a few words of each others' language I really felt she was my friend. Equally lovely was Murile who cleaned our room daily and did many other things in the hotel to make things run so smoothly. Thank you Murile for keeping the room so nice! We had such a good time in Deniz House. It's the kind of place where you look forward to getting back after being away because you feel like you are coming home to visit family. We felt so welcome. Thanks to all the staff at Deniz House who made our stay the very best. We will surely go back there. Hello to our friends Kerem, Ayten and Murile. Hope you are well and may God bless you always.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic value, big rooms in new building with beautiful roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: cheetahbaby
Reviews.Content: This was such a lovely hotel, we contemplated canceling our later reservations in Istanbul. Unfortunately the other hotels were already paid for, and we ended up coming back to Deniz houses for our last night in Istanbul. The hotel is simple, high quality, very close to the blue mosque, aya sofia, basilia cistern, etc. Near by is the Arrasta Bazarr and the excellent shisha joint where locals seems to enjoy late night live music. Tripadvisor reviewers had mentioned loud subway heard in rooms on one side of the hotel, so I was initially quite weary. When the hotel immediately reached out to us after we booked our room, I took the opportunity to specify that we wanted a room away from the subway. They confirmed this with very quick turnaround. The service was very efficient. When we arrived, the friendly staff checked us into building B, which is practically attached to the original Deniz houses. We had room 9 which was a very large room for Istanbul, based on our later experiences at other hotels. This room could sleep 3 with double and a single, the bathroom was compact but smart. The bedding was soo comfortable and the pillows were a dream to have. The floor was a nice wood and the curtains tastefully done. It really felt like a nice apartment, with a plasma TV and pretty and new looking Turkish carpet on the floor. The room was very clean. Breakfast was on the rooftop terrace, with stunning view of the bosphorous and a peak at the blue mosque which is 5 minutes walk away. The breakfast was full, with hot and cold offerings, including eggs, olives, feta, tomatoes, cereal, etc. Plenty of butter, jam, and fruits to go around. It was very pleasant to sit on top and enjoy breakfast. i would love to do it all over again. The hotel also was very helpful in arranging laundry service which came back very clean and procuring tickets to shows without charging us a service fee. The only problem we had was electricity outage on our first night there. But the problem was fixed quickly and we went on to thoroughly enjoy our stay. Again, we enjoyed it so much we came back for our last night in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Sohasoha
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights there at the end of June. Room was really cozy, great sea view, clean bathroom. Very friendly and professional staff, always helpful: the receptionists make you feel welcome and help you with whatever questions you might have, and Ayten, the lady who fixes breakfast ,does a wonderful job. The view from the breakfast room is awesome (one one side you can see the roofs of Istanbul , on the other side the sea). Only one problem: no hot water one night, but the receptionist fixed it immediately after I told him about it. Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy clean place”
Reviews.Author: Draculi
Reviews.Content: Pros: It was a clean place, the rooms were not too big, not too small (but you don't spend time in your room), the bathroom was nice and clean with all amenities, it had a small balcony, A/C, it had a very nice breakfast, and nice and polite staff. Cons: It is closed to the railway but you really don't hear the train excepting in the morning when is time to get up, and the prices for a room with the Marmara see (where the railway was) were a little more than they should be. The hotel had very nice tours, but I would not take the Bosporus tour as you can do it on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanny_nau
Reviews.Content: the rate was cheaper than some other hotels and we were apprehensive about the hotel conditions. But it had some good tripadvisor feedback which made me book the hotel. The room was small but sufficient for two of us. The bathroom was nice and clean. They had a sign in the room requesting us to use the AC only between July and September. It was june but we felt hot so we used it awyways. The breakfast was okay. not the best. On the first morning, we went for a late breakfast at 10 (the breakfast time is 8-10:30). Though we were 30 minutes the and of breakfast time, some of the food had already finished. My wife was a little upset about it, but the kitchen maid were friendly and informal and made some items again. They could do with some selecton of cold meat (sausages, salamis) in the breakfast. Not sure how the sea view rooms are, but the top floor sea view room has balconies with low ceilings. They also have wi-fi service and computer in the adjacent sister hotel (Deniz A) can be used. Overall, not a bad experience and good value.

Reviews.Title: “I felt at home in this cosy, neat and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Havelduene
Reviews.Content: I liked Deniz houses ..its a simple, yet comfortable and friendly place.. I had a very pleasant stay. There was always soneone I could ask for advice, my double room for single use was comfortable and clean, and had a quite spacious and clean bathroom....and a big window to the sea! Breakfast was georgious- 5 kinds of olives, several kinds of white cheese, bread, butter honey confitures, fruits and cookies.....and eating on the roof looking at the Hagia Sophia..and the sea...made breakfast a special experience. Location is very good: In walking distance are f.ex.the blue mosque, a smaller and a big bazar, many restaurrants and coffeeplaces...and a tramway- all a tourist needs.... As I prefer small hotels with atmosphere to big hotels this was just the place for me..and I will surely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good simple place in the tourist area of town”
Reviews.Author: khuang82
Reviews.Content: Deniz Hotel is a great hotel in the tourist quarter of town. It's a short walk to the main attractions, such as the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, Aya Sofya, etc. At night there's not very much to do around Sultanahmet, however, and prices for food and drinks are inflated. I would recommend the Taksim area if you'd rather be closer to a more bustling, hip and busy part of town. Deniz Hotel has two buildings, and I stayed in the 'B' building. I don't think there's a difference in quality, and the 'B' building is a couple doors down from the main one. The rooftop terrace is a bit small, but has good views. Breakfast was simple, but adequate. The room was clean, comfortable and relatively roomy. The front door and door to the bathroom were a little hard to close and get locked. I had to put a lot of my weight into it just to get the door locked. The shower stall in the leaked water like crazy onto the bathroom floor, but was otherwise clean. The walls are a little thin, but not as bad as other reviewers have suggested. You could definitely hear some noise, especially from cleaning crew in hallway, but not so much from other rooms. Overall it was a great place to stay. Definitely take a map and a business card from this place the first night or so, because it's easy to get lost. Location is good for sight seeing, but not for night life. If you're looking for a good, simple place in Sultanahmet, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanBeautician
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager is very friendly and eager to make the stay a positive memory. The breakfast buffet was very nice, everything freshly prepared, the view from the top floor, on which breakfast is served is awesome - and the floor is accessible the whole day!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable for the price”
Reviews.Author: WearyTraveller186338
Reviews.Content: I can't speak too highly of this establishment. Rooms are spacious and immaculate, good mattresses and bed linen, nice ungarish decor, good bathroom, good wifi signal, great breakfast, excellent terrace, professional staff, unbeatable location. We stayed a week previously at the more expensive Niles hotel (75 euros instead of 50), and actually preferred this place.

Reviews.Title: “I will come back to Deniz House! Love it :)”
Reviews.Author: daffodilz
Reviews.Content: was traveling in Turkey on a solo trip, Deniz House was recommended by Backpacker Travel (best travel agency for Turkey trip! strongly recommended). twice i visited istanbul, i was given the most beautiful room in the hotel! Room 1 which is on ground level, facing the Marmara Sea with a little balcony & Room 16 which is on the highest floor of the hotel, still facing the Marmara Sea with a little balcony :) View from Room 16 was fantastic! i couldnt have asked for more! it was right outside the breakfast area (and they serve tea/coffee all day long). beside the little breakfast area, you can also choose to go out the little patio for a nice sunset breeze overlooking the Blue Mosque. The hotel is within walking distance (15-20mins or so) to the main Sultanhamet area (restuarants, blue mosque, hagia sophia, grand bazzar, turkish bath, metro etc) Room is great! comfy bed, pillow, clean sheet, well maintained wooden floor, bathroom is fresh and clean with towels & everything else you need. What is missing is bottled water, which you can get it across the street from a little shop. Mr Kerem, the Reception Manager (day shift) is very friendly, helpful and down to earth. The other night shift manager, sorry cant remember his name, is equally friendly and sincere. I felt well taken care of and safe in this hotel as a female solo traveller! not forgetting breakfast selection is good, all sort of bread, cheese, jam, eggs, cereal etc. I would recommend Deniz House to anyone who is looking for a hotel with decent price & great service! Thank you to the team at Deniz House and Backpackers Travel!

Reviews.Title: “clean, nice seaview, excellend amenities, snacks upstairs”
Reviews.Author: dogal11
Reviews.Content: very nice and clean rooms, all little details are well thought out (slippers are provided etc.), room floors nice wood, bathrooms very clean and large. If you get a seaside room, excellent views as well. Cake/snacks available upstairs all the time. Receptionist is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to much, but the manager did his best to make up for it”
Reviews.Author: elderlycouple8273
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a dowdy appearance; as soon as we went into the room, we had to fetch the maid because the bathroom was grubby. When we asked for a room with a double bed, they simply pushed the two singles together - very uncomfortable. The shower was extremely slippery - dangerously so. Breakfast was excellent and varied and the server pleasant and anxious to please. This can be said for all the staff, particularly the manager, who acted almost as a travel agent for us, arranging all our activities, even going out to instruct the taxi driver where. necessary.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location doing cultural sites”
Reviews.Author: leschlossherr
Reviews.Content: perfect location for doing cultural sites extremely friendly and helpful staff very clean and quiet rooms nice, maybe a bit small for two

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, let down slightly by the airport transfer”
Reviews.Author: BalW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul and is therefore ideally placed for visits to many of the major sights (Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome etc). There were also a number of very nice restaurants within a 15 minute walk radius so the location was a real bonus. Our room was clean and comfortable but the real highlight was the breakfast on the roof terrace, which gave great views over the Istanbul skyline and the Sea of Marmara. The staff were generally friendly and helpful too. The only real issue we had was with their airport transfer service. The hotel's website features a picture of a Mercedes minivan and claims that you will be offered "complimentary snacks&drinks on the way to hotel for refreshment". In fact we were picked up in a battered old motor, and there were no drinks and snacks.... While I wouldn't have minded this too much if it was cheap, we had paid 50 Euros for this one way trip, which is more than a taxi would have cost and about three times the cost we paid for a shuttle bus on the way back so we felt a bit ripped off and misled by the false advertisement on the website. That aside though, an enjoyable stay and I would stay there again. I'd just get the shuttle bus from the airport next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that I highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: AV2186338
Reviews.Content: We staid 4 nights on a very nice double bedroom with a pleasant balcony and a view on the Bosphorus. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topcapl: everything is in walking distance. We really loved breakfast: lots of food, very local and fresh and we enjoyed it on the terrasse! The hotel also offers arrangements for visits, hammam, retaurantsâ€¦ and the team is very friendly and happy to help. I would highly recommend the Deniz House for a stay in Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Great terrace, shame about the room change!”
Reviews.Author: Di222
Reviews.Content: We booked 2nights through Bookings.com with sea view. Fantastic large room with balcony. Great view etc. We requested to stay another night and was given a very different and much more expensive rate, but accepted just to avoid moving for our last night in Istanbul. Not told we would be moved to another premises across the road. This room was tiny, very small bathroom and quite noisy overlooking the road. Too late to do anything about it, but beware if you want to extend your stay of this catch. Clean and comfortable place, but with so many others available shop around extensively.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: peter_theunynck
Reviews.Content: Deniz Houses has a perfect location, in the shadow of the Blue Mosque in the beautiful Sultanahmet quarter. Very near to all the beautiful monuments and places of Istanbul. The rooms are not spectacular, but they are clean, have a good bed and a small but comfortable bathroom. The people at the reception desk are really nice and helpful. They also organised our transport to the airport at a fair price. Probably the most important asset of the hotel is the breakfast room at the roof of the hotel. While you are taking your breakfast (very nice) you have a wonderful view on the city and the Sea of Marmara.

Reviews.Title: “Always a warm welcome at Deniz House”
Reviews.Author: Helen20003
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth stay at Deniz House and we can always count on a warm, friendly welcome. All of the staff, from the manager in the lobby to the ladies at breakfast are eager to help make our stay comfortable. The seaview rooms allow us to watch ships making their way to the Black Sea. While the regular rooms are smaller,they are equally clean and comfortable. A traditional Turkish breakfast is served upstairs with views of he Bosporus.The hotel is within easy walking distance (even for senior travelers) of many sight and the tram. This year the wi-fi works better.

Reviews.Title: “good value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: minford
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location and is extremely good value for money. It's quiet, clean and comfortable. Very welcoming, good service and a wdie range of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service along with great location”
Reviews.Author: tomumo
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, clean room, close to major attractions. Not a deluxe place, but considering the cost it's good value for the money. Free high-speed WiFi in each room was a must and that I got.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location to visit the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: travellingcouple2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Deniz's from February 24th to March 1st 2011. We had a wonderful stay. No bad surprises. We received what we hoped. Good cleaning standards (just some black humidity lines in the shower but everything was very clean). We have been in the room no. 2 on the ground floor and we were not disturb by the noise that we have read in some other reviews. The railway is very close but we could sleep well anyway. At reservation we have asked to remove carpets for allergic problems and our requests were completely fulfilled. Breakfast room clean and pleasant on the top floor with a good choice of food. Coffee and Tea available all day long in the Breakfast room is something very appreciated. Quality/Price: very very good. We felt to be in a quiet and safe area (we walked back to the hotel even late at night and the feeling was very positive), ideal place for visiting the town: 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the Santa Sophia. We are planning to go back to Istanbul because we had a wonderful time and for sure our accommodation will be at Deniz. We took the taxi transfer from the Airport to the hotel and it was worth the 20 Euro fare (they were there waiting for us. The taxi van was just for us. Clean van and polite staff.) From the hotel back to the Airport we took a 5â‚¬/per person shuttle-van that you find out of the hotel but just because we had plenty of time for the flight (we made the tour of the town to pick-up many other people from other hotels and the van was not very clean) and the service was suitable to its price.

Reviews.Title: “It was a friendly place with a nice room and verry good service and a helpfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: familiebrost
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in the center of the old part of Instanbul near all thr famous ancient Buildings, mosques and the Topkaki Palace.All the places about 15 minutes away from the hotel. Nice ,clean rooms with view to the Mamarian Sea. Friendly and helpfull staff at the reception and in the breakfast aerea, plentifull breakfast-buffet.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: pitstyle
Reviews.Content: go for room nr 16 if you want to have a nice view and no trains noise. Anyway one of the best place to stay in the old part of the town. Very good people very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Kerem, Ayten and all the staff at Deniz Houses, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: frances782
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay in Istanbul and despite the weather we had a wonderful holiday. All the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful, in giving us directions, advising us on opening times, setting up the car to take us back to the airport and in helping us to print off our boarding passes. Kerem was the senior receptionist and arranged a booking for us to see the Dervishes but everyone was equally helpful. Thank you Ayten for ensuring that the delicious breakfast buffet was always topped up. Our room was very small but as we spent so little time there that was not a problem, the main thing was that it was very clean and also quiet. Storage space was adequate for our short stay and the bathroom was very clean. You can see the Bue Mosque from the dining room balcony and the old city is less than 10 minutes walk away. We didn't nee to use public transport at all. Walking back late at night was not a problem as the city is very safe. Good restaurants nearby and also in the old town. Great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money,”
Reviews.Author: drzahidimran
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent. The breakfast at the rooftop is great. Caution: better physical shape will help climb stairs. Trust the front desk with information about area. Internet works well and is free. I wish I had the permission from the staff and manager to thank them for their services. Be prepared to climb a few step of stairs when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxation after exhausting days”
Reviews.Author: Kobzoska
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable room. Very helpful and friendly people at the reception. Great location. Delicious breakfast with the view of the sea.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CARING STAFF & COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: GROW756
Reviews.Content: We came to Istanbul for a two week work project with a team of people. We needed an economically moderate location, yet comfortable. We found it at the Deniz House! The front desk help was outstanding, the lady who cared for us in the kitchen for breakfasts was equally helpfu! The hotel did all they could to accomodate our need for a meeting room and cared for us with great Turkish hospitality! Beautiful view of the sea and if you want a more Turkish experie3nce with comfort this is it! We recommend it unequivocally!

Reviews.Title: “great value and very kind staff”
Reviews.Author: craiggus
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the lobby of this boutique hotel I felt at home. The staff at the front desk were always kind and extremely helpful with every request I had - from directions to obscure places, the best Turkish bath, good places to eat, and where to get good deals. The breakfasts were an excellent spread of Mediterranean diet served by always smiling staff. At nights, the rooms and environs were always quiet. From one balcony you have an excellent view of the Sultan Ahmet (Blue) Mosque while the other balcony is a clear view of the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saragressiv
Reviews.Content: Small, intimate and calm hotel. Staff perfect, nice, helpful and available to answer your questions. Breakfast correct. Rooms really clean, modern. Hotel really well located in the old neighborhood of Istanbul, Sultanhamet. However : we have been cold. The hotel, the terrasse where we ate and the room weren't heated enough. We haven't been able to book a room for 3adults on the website "Lastminute.com" even if this kind of room was available. So we paid for 2 rooms, but we just used one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, inexpensive guest house!”
Reviews.Author: Jergen93
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Deniz House Hotel. We booked on Lastminute.com and got a really great deal. As far as we could tell, the hotel is divided into two buildings. We were in the main building (the one with the reception desk), on the top floor next to the breakfast area. The room was clean, definitely large enough (in spite of some others on here saying the rooms were small), and had a cute balcony with some chairs facing the sea. I wasn't kept up by traffic noises, in spite of what others have said in reviews. There was also a spotless, well-appointed bathroom with a shower and tub (though we couldn't get enough hot water for a bath). Our room had a nice flat screen TV that got multiple channels in Turkish, two in English, and one in German. The people working at this hotel are so extremely nice and helpful. Our luggage was delayed and they very patiently called the airport to check on it for each of our repeated requests. They also arranged a transfer back to the airport at the end of our stay, which was fine, convenient, and adorably involved us getting free cherry juice boxes and raisin cakes. We really enjoyed breakfast as well, though it might not be to your taste if you're looking for pancakes, sausage, and cooked foods. It was more fresh yogurt with toppings, fruits and vegetables, olives, cheese, breads, cookies, and hard boiled eggs. There were also some tasty cheesy potatoes, and the usual coffee, tea, and juice. The women preparing the breakfast were very kind. They leave out cookies, coffee, and tea in the afternoon and evenings, which was appreciated but nothing to get excited over. The hotel was located very close to the Hippodrome and other major tourist sites, but not on a main/busy road. We walked everywhere. It does involve some walking in hilly areas to get anywhere, so be prepared for that. In terms of Internet access, we didn't attempt to use the wireless, but walked around the corner to their sister hotel daily to check our email on the two computers they have in the lobby. I wouldn't count on getting work done there but it was certainly fine for email, looking up some information, etc. Overall, we loved staying here and would recommend it to anyone looking for a clean and pleasant (but not really luxury) stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: Moinoniin
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel, ideally located to explore the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul and the rest of the city. Very friendly and helpful staff, spotlessly clean room and a good breakfast. A great place to spend a few days exploring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy place, really great value for money”
Reviews.Author: agonzalezr73
Reviews.Content: We traveled all the way up from Israel to Turkey, through Jordan and Syria, and Deniz Houses at Istanbul (main building, not the B annex, double room with a sea-view) was the best hotel we were in, regarding value for money. It is not only that rooms have a very reasonable price, but also you get really nice, clean, cozy rooms and very formal and polite service. We were not exactly on a budget, but very close to it, so Deniz was like the perfect choice. Definitely reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the heart of city”
Reviews.Author: u30004
Reviews.Content: After searching the internet endlessly for a decent hotel for a budget price, I booked 3 nights with Deniz houses and it was worth the money. Upon arrival, the reception staff treated us well, and gave us the room we booked. The room was clean and the view from the balcony was nice. The staff didn't try to force sell any tours, which was a relief. There is wi-fi internet, but the downside is that it only works on the ground floor which is a bit frustrating. There are train tracks next to the hotel, but we didn't find it to be a problem. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Value and Very Polite Service”
Reviews.Author: traveller_ah
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 times. First in July 2010 and then in January 2011. Both times with my wife. In Julay we stayed in standard room, in January in sea view one. Overall greate value for money. In summer you can get double room near all major historic sites for only 40 Euro. Plus terrace is great and you can even self-serve tea prepare in kitchen at any time. Stuff is extremely helpful and polite. They even helped me to find nearest working drugstore in middle of night when was needed. The only downside is train going under windows of seaview rooms, yet closed window solves the issue:) They also have airconditioning in every room, so noise is not a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, small boutique-like hotel with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gary_W98502
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Deniz Houses for three different periods in October and November, 2010. The two buildings are converted houses, so rooms can be somewhat small, but the decor and cleanliness more than compensate. Access to the rooms and the top floor eating areas are by a steep, winding central stairway, so persons with mobility concerns will probably want to go elsewhere. The location is good, but as other travelers have noted, if noise is a concern, you should try for a room away from the water side where the railroad tracks are. The tram line and also the Grand Bazaar are about a 10 to 15 minute walk up hill, as are the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia and the Hippodrome area. Since the streets are winding and can be confusing, if you walk back downhill to the hotel, you will likely want to consult a very detailed map from time to time until you are thoroughly familiar with the route. The e-mail responses to our reservation requests were prompt, and we greatly appreciated all the help and kindness from the Deniz Houses reception staff persons. The housekeepers provide the best buffet breakfasts we have had on our travels. We used the hotel's transfer service from the airport on our initial arrival and also when we left the city for the final time. The cars are comfortable and the drivers reliable and friendly. We hope to stay there again during future times in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel friendly staff in Sultanahemnt close to the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: elizabethaa8823
Reviews.Content: Our room was near the top of the hotel with a sea view - the downside was that the train tracks and road are on this side of the building so could be a little noisy. The location is great and within easy walking distance of the major sites - the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace and the not to be missed amazing underground Cistern. Sultanahmet tram stop is within 15 minutes walk which takes you further afield. The staff were extremely polite and friendly and arranged an early morning airport transfer for us to Ataturk for â‚¬20.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, serviceminded staff, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: AgnetaSundstrom
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Old Town close to Blue Mosque and walking distance to Grand Bazar. Clean rooms and good breakfast buffet at top floor with a sea view. Free coffee and tea and snacks during the entire day was very appreciated. Small rooms

Reviews.Title: “The breakfast is great, the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, it's near all the big Istanbul sites, but make perfe”
Reviews.Author: BenAAdana
Reviews.Content: We were lead to this hotel by some friends who had sugggested that if we go there to ask for one of several rooms that were quiet. So in makiing the reservations I specified some room numbers and was told that i could have them. The online reservation system works well and the interaction by email was good. when we got there we were told that all the rooms that we had asked for were full, but they had another quiet room instead. What a nightmare. It was right over the train tracks and the main road into town. Every 20 minutes a train went by. I am not a light sleeper and I hardly slept that night. At 5 in the morning I went downa and said that was enought, that we either got a new room or we were outta there. We had our breakfast which is varied and good and overlooking the sea. We went out to see about other hotels and then went to see about our new room. It was quiet and clean and comfortable. Prices are reasonable and close to a lot of great sites. Staff is wonderful. When we left we inspected all the rooms and specifically said when we came back we would like a certain room. We came back and we could not get that room. We got another that was fine. Being courteous is one thing, but saying something is going to happen is not what I like in a hotel. I would stay here again, but I'm sorry i had to be adamint about something about trains rumbling through every 20 minutes. This is a place worth considering, but check out the rooms first, and look out the window to see what is there.

Reviews.Title: “nice, little hotel next to the old quarter”
Reviews.Author: IngoHanoi
Reviews.Content: I have had a very nice time in Instanbul and a very nice hotel either. The service was friendly, clear rooms and sanitary, perfect location next to blue mosque (5min.), Haggia Sophia (10Min.) and Grand Bazar (10min) by feet, large breakfast selection and last but not least unbeatable price performance ratio. Nice and sheap hotel without expensive chichi crowd like pool, sauna, wellness!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable place in a city where tourists are hasseled a lot”
Reviews.Author: river62
Reviews.Content: Felt good to stay in a place that operated so well, all matters were taken care of punctually. This hotel felt safe and the staff there felt like they were doing their job enjoying it, they had time to advise and even teach few words of turkish language in spare moments. The city can be tiring for tourists : to be constantly offered or asked for something. In this hotel we had nice breakfast every morning and slept our nights well, there were no noisy groups waking you up. This way we had great vacation in Istanbul, we spent days walking and discovering new neighbourhoods and atmospheres in this very beautiful and interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Super star staff and management. I loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: soheilaaras
Reviews.Content: I loved the friendly staff and the hospitality I received during my 3 weeks of stay in this hotel. I am planning to go back to Istanbul next year and I will not think about where to stay for a second. I already know ! 2 thumbs up . Kamil, you are an awesome manager and I appreciate every thing you do for your guests. Also lots and lots of thanks to your friendly and amazing ataff ,Kerem, Murife, Ayten, Ayse, Elif and Ekrem. Thank you every body..... so much :-) Soheila Los Angeles, California

Reviews.Title: “Friendly cheap and good location even with sea view”
Reviews.Author: flywhc
Reviews.Content: The Deniz Houses hotel is located at very central Sutanahmet where most major attractions such as the blue mosque and Aya Sophia in Istanbul are in walking distance (all in 10 minutes). many resturant around and a traditional shopping street is next to the blue mosque. It is a very traditional Turkish area and the hotel is Turkish too such as wooden floor with carpet etc. It is not next to the sea but it is amazing it has beautiful sea view from the top floor where we had breakfast. The host of the hotel are very friendly. He arranged cruise and other tours for us. We asked around in other travel agents and found they always offered cheapist deals we could get. And the 4 days tour they arranged after leaving the hotel was also enjoyable. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ashoksaxena99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was picked up based on reviews on tripadvisor and looking at Hotel site. But no one talked of Metro train tracks right behind hotel so every 15 minutes you have to enjoy good noise in room.If can sleep with Noise around you are welcome there.If you do not mind dirty carpets pl go there.Only saving grace was staff on duty which was helpful on information about place and town. Rating ZERO star

Reviews.Title: “A perfect example of Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: peggyfleming18
Reviews.Content: We were promptly picked up at the airport and driven to the small hotel. It was better than we expected with a view of the Bosphorus from our room. The breakfasts that were included were marvelous and abundant. The staff were quiet and courteous and ready to help. The desk workers spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming & homey”
Reviews.Author: ththnguy
Reviews.Content: The staff made our stay very comfortable. They welcomed us and tended to our needs. It was like staying with family. Reception was great! House cleaning was helpful! Kitchen staff made you feel like mom was cooking in the kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: FredLivorno
