Reviews.Content: Good Location. Well positioned close to the main historic areas of the city. Young staff, certainly not yet perfect but very honest and available. Something not important to increase about the rooms, as doors not perfectly closing, but as I already said, not important. I sincerely suggest it to my friends and to everyone interested to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, but management changed room/rates after reservation”
Reviews.Author: Californiavisitor01
Reviews.Content: The room/bed was clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and knowledgable, and the breakfast was excellent. It's a great location for walking to top attractions, but we had a lot of traffic noise when the windows were open. Unfortunately, after we had made the reservation in person, were shown the room we would have, and were told that our last night would have a lower rate because it was after the peak season, we arrived back in Istanbul to find that we had been given a different room (on a higher floor = more stairs), and the lower rate would not apply for our 4th and last night. We felt we had been taken in a "bait and switch" scam, which diminished our enjoyment of the hotel. We would recommend it with this warning that the management may not honor their agreement.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable shelter by the sea”
Reviews.Author: Sanchopanza51
Reviews.Content: Concluding a three week trip across Arabia, this hotel provided all I needed during my three night stay before returning home to London. It is located close, mostly within walking distance, to many of Istanbul's most interesting sites. It has good views over the sea. It is clean, comfortable, and its staff courteous and english speaking. I would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay, very friendly and helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: jeffery03
Reviews.Content: Great location and very helpful and friendly staff. Room was spotlessly clean and very well equipped. Buffet breakfast on the terrace was very good with a terrific view. Our transport from and to the airport was arranged by the hotel and worked perfectly. Reasonably priced for its facilities and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place for flexible, bargain-to-mid-price travelers”
Reviews.Author: ConestogaWay
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is somewhat on the edge of the Old Istanbul sites in a "real neighborhood" (vs. rows of side-by-side hotels and restaurants closer to the big mosques). It's a leisurely 10-minute walk (up) to the Blue Mosque (and to the nearest tram stop). But it's also far more quiet than being 50 meters from a mosque with calls-to-prayer starting around 0500 and large rumbling tourist buses in the streets. (You can still walk almost everywhere in the old district and grab a tram to go north to the ferries and across the Golden Horn if you wish. In other words, you can avoid the taxis which almost always will over-charge you.) If you're clear this property is part of a class of "special class hotels" in Istanbul (many converted from 19th century "town houses") and not at all like a typical, big "corporate" hotel, then you can view it for what it is: a small (only about 14 rooms) hotel, with some nice modern touches (flat-screen TV), air conditioning (that, unlike many hotels, you can leave on at a moderate temp while you're gone), a mini-refrigerator, comfortable beds, and small but modern bathrooms. So you get a safe, small, Spartan room, with a spotless, tiled bath at a good price. You won't get certain things you might miss: a folding stand for luggage, etc. (but you will get a brand new pair of slippers and a first-aid kit). You can see a room on this website page: http://www.turkeytravelplanner.com/go/Istanbul/hotels/districts/kayasofya/deniz_konak.html Look closely at the two room photos. You can see virtually all the furnishings including the small vanity/mini-desk. (By the way, http://www.turkeytravelplanner.com is an excellent resource for Istanbul.) If you have your choice of rooms, I'd get one on the front of the building vs. the rear. And if you travel "heavy," you need to know there are no lifts and no bell staff to help with bags. Breakfast, on the top floor with views of both of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque, is in the style of most Istanbul hotels -- sliced meats and cheeses, fresh vegetables, yoghurt and toppings, four or five types of bread and rolls and beverages -- fresh and good and more than enough to get you through mid-day. Free internet is available in the lobby and on the terrace level but not in most rooms. Note: When I was there, only the manager, the charming Kerem Benligil, spoke English. Perhaps because of language issues, the staff tend to mirror what they see. If you're warm and gracious, they'll be. If you're not, they may be more reserved. (That seemed to be true in many places in Istanbul. Learn at least a few Turkish words and the place will seem much friendlier.) Deniz Houses (plural) includes a second building about ten meters away that appears to be newer, but I didn't check it out although I could see its views are different -- probably not quite as good. (The proprietor also owns two other nearby properties and the highly-reliable transfer-service to and from the airport called Backpacker Travel Agency.) (While in Istanbul, I also stayed in a range of hotels including Sari Konek, Erboy Hotel, and Ararat Hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: pele006
Reviews.Content: Although it took a couple of minutes to find, it was worth the effort. My room was spotless, and had all facilities required. Friendly and helpful staff as well as a good, however basic, breakfast. I would definitely consider Deniz Houses when next in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Staff is very nice but hotel condition is not.”
Reviews.Author: loonad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Deniz Konak in July. We came together with my family and husband. It was first trip of my mother and we wished it to be precious but the room that staff offered us was very unconformable despite that we ordered it 2 month before. it was the room in the roof with low ceiling and very hot. Because of traffic no one can sleep in rooms they provided us. The next day they moved us to another building of the hotel. The rooms here was very good and modern than previous one but without hot water. After some hours we could have a chance to take a shower. The breakfast should be improved since it was poor. The only thing that is nice is that it is near to the Sultanahmed and view from balcony. The staff was very helpful. I hope this hotel will be improved and the same staff remained. :) Anyway thanks.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Dashamato
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very clean, whatever you need they will sort it out for you....i was very pleased! :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kerri162
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean, comfortable room. Two buildings, so important to let outside callers know which one you are in in order to avoid confusion when receiving calls/ visitors. Only downside - wireless internet was not working in my room during my stay, so had to go to the lobby to go online. The potato dish at breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “didn't like”
Reviews.Author: Ika84
Reviews.Content: I reserved one double room in Deniz konak hotel. This room must have been normal room (not terrace with lower roof). But by arriving they sent us to terrace room, next to kitchen. It was because there is no free room available. But i made reservation on May for July. Thanks to my Turkish friend after talks with administrator we were moved to another building of Deniz Konak where in the evening there was no hot water. In addition, it should be noted that when staff member from Deniz Konak met us in ariport, he didn;t help with our luggage. Me and my mother carried heavy luggage without any help from him. overall very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant suprise in the middle of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Barney37SaudiArabia
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Istanbul and were meet by our tour company 'Backpacker', they then took us to Deniz House; staff there are excellent and helpful. The rooms are not enormous but are clean and comfortable. Breakfast on the rooftop was wonderful. Like most places in Istanbul it has stairs that you need to climb. When I return to Istanbul I will stay here again, becuase of location, comfort and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, value & staff”
Reviews.Author: nmarci99
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit in Istanbul. Last time we stayed in the Hotel Ida. After it I thought that Ida is the best value hotel in Sultanahmet. Unfortunately this year they were full. So I had to find another hotel, and I booked a double in the Deniz House. Now I think, last year I was wrong, the Deniz House is the best value hotel in Sultanahmet. I try to compare this two excellent hotels: For 35â‚¬ we had a basement room in the Ida (no AC - don't need - towels and TV), in the Deniz House we had a room on the 2nd floor with a silence street-view, in the room we had an LCD TV, towels, slippers, soap, shampoo, fridge and AC. (I think it was a special price.) The staff is very friendly in both hotel. In the Ida it is more familiar, and in the Deniz is more proffessional. The breakfast is a turkish breakfast in the Ida, but in the Deniz you can choose from different dishes (meats, olives, jams, boiled egg, fruits, corn flakes, sauces) The Ida is more closer to the main sights (5 min walk), but the Deniz isn't too far also (10 min walk). I think next time I wil try to book in the Deniz first.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled2125
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Istanbul and we felt very fortunate to have booked this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable and well appointed with a great view of the Sea of Marmara. The hotel is tucked away on a quiet street, although on our side of the hotel there was noise from both the commuter rail line and the busy street that runs along the waterfront far below. This wasn't really a problem though since things quieted down at night. If we have one complaint it would be that all rooms on the sea side of the hotel are not equal when it comes to balconies. We paid ten euros extra per night for a balcony but really had just a door that opened onto a ledge enclosed by a wrought iron railing. One of the rooms beside us and one below clearly had an actual balcony. Still it was nice to be able to open the door and stand on our little ledge and watch all the activity on the water. The best part of this hotel besides the cleanliness, comfortable room and fabulous breakfast on the rooftop terrace, was the staff - very helpful and friendly - as a result we would recommend the place without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariska_kleevens
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel in a great area of Ä°stanbul. Highly recommended for solo travelers and couple. Very nice and cozy home away from home. No lift but with not too much luggage no problem. Ä° stayed in Ä±n the original hotel and the new wing and used the internet facilities of Sultan's Inn. All very good and very friendly staff. Incredible breakfast on the rooftop terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 186338James99
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly, helpful and full of advice without being pushy. The Hotel is situated very close to many of the main attractions of Istanbul so making exploration easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value of money and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: PakistanMehwish
Reviews.Content: good value of money,rooms were small but tidy and well furnished.location of hotel is ideal blue mosque,hagia sophia are five minutes walk from the hotel.grand/spice bazar is 20 min walk.staff was friendly.over all its a nice hotel for stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: StephanieIK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this small hotel for 5 nights. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was convenient -- right in Sultanhamet, walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, palace, Grand Bazaar, etc. I liked the view with my rooftop breakfasts -- but beware of the seagulls who will swoop down and pilfer your plate given half a chance. My room actually faced the train tracks but I was so tired from walking all day that I didn't notice the soundof the train at all. There is wireless internet in the lobby, not in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Narmak
Reviews.Content: Synopsis (Overall + Value) After being disappointed with Angel's Home Hotel, we stayed here - turned out to be a good decision. Charming rooms, good service and location, all at a good price - would recommend this place! Location 5-10minutes walk from the Blue Mosque etc - well placed away from the noisy streets but close enough to the action. Hotel Room Charming room, nicely furnished with views (either of the sea or the city, depending on which you choose). Small flat panel TV, complimentary slippers, first aid pack (!). Bathroom was a good size and comfortable. Bed Comfortable and no problems. Staff Spoke very good english, very friendly and helpful Internet/Wifi Wifi is ONLY available at reception and not in the bedrooms/terrace, sadly. Housekeeping Daily service, well kept. Breakfast Served at the roof, where there is a small terrace. Good range of food and tea. The juice didn't taste nice, but there was plenty of other stuff to keep us well fed. Airport transfer They collected us on time, and it was a good pickup service. Other Stylish and charming rooms, friendly staff - would definitely return here should I come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: marnow
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really comfortable for people who want to see Sultanahmet. Is is about 5-10 minutes of walking to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Hippodrom. For breakfasts you can choose what you like, food is always fresh and choice is rather large. At any time (midday, evening) you can prepare tea or coffe for free. Rooms are clean and staff is friendly and helpfull. They all speak English really well and there is no communication problem. I would say that this is really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cameron G
Reviews.Content: Rooms were exactly what we wanted - decent price, very clean, had wifi. The location of the hotel is great, 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and Arasta Bazaar. It was only 12TL back in cab from the more modern Galatasaray area - we went out to bars and cabbies had no problem using the hotel card. Staff were friendly and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in the historic Sultan Ahmed Area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LuitanantUhura
Reviews.Content: A very friendly smallish hotel in a nice historic neighborhood at the foothill of the great SultanAhmed sighseeing area. The entire neighborhood seems to have undergone extensive renovation during the past couple of years, the historic streetscapes have been beautifully restored. The hotel itself offers clean and cosy room and amiable service. Breakfast is served on the topfloor with some view of the Mamara Sea. The Mamara seaside rooms,however, can be a bit on the noisy side due to the nearby trainline and main road. The rooms facing inland are a bit less airy, but more quit. The hotel is very clean and staff very friendly. However, do not expect luxury or culinary extravagance for this price. Breakfast is tasty, rooms clean, comfortable and cosy. I think that is all you can expect for this price, the good value for money makes this small, perfectly located hotel (for sightseeing) a very good option for an Istanbul stay. Be aware business travellers: Business in Istanbul takes place North of the Golden Horn, you might wanna look out for a location in Taksim area instead. Again, Sightseers: Deniz Konak is a very good option for exploring most of the historic city.

Reviews.Title: “A very informal, relaxed not flashy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hafauk
Reviews.Content: We booked the Deniz Konak as part of a deal with Expedia. It was within our rather modest budget and the other reviews in Trip Advisor seemed good enough for us. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon having taken advantage of the hotel's offer of transport from Ataturk airport for 20 euros. At reception we were told that our room wasn't available until the next day but that they would take us to one of their other hotels. That didn't bother us and it was only 5 minutes away. It was called the Tashkonak and seemed fine to us, though we did have a room on the ground floor which was very noisy at night. The Deniz Konak hotel is a small hotel with less than 20 rooms, it is also a small building and tall people might have to mind their heads a bit. In fact neither my wife or myself could acually stand up in the shower as there was a large beam in the way. Our room was very nice, clean and had a view of the Sea of Marmara. One drawback of a sea view is that there is a railway right in front of the hotel and the Sea is incredibly busy and the large boats drone their way up and down all day and night. There is double glazing but not much use if you sleep with a window open. Breakfast is served on the top floor where there is a good variety of cereals, yoghurt, cheese, meats etc. plus tea and coffee. One of the things that we really liked about the hotel was the fact that this room was open from the afternoon until late at night and you could make yourself teas and coffees as much as you liked. The hotel is in the old part of Istanbul and only 10 minutes from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel but there was a slightly annoying thing at the end. We had to pay for our airport transfers and a taxi ride that we had got the hotel to organise. As it was at thye end of our holiday we had very little Turkish money left so had to pay by card. The hotel really wanted us to pay in cash and added a large charge for paying by card. This really annoyed me but didn't feel like arguing the point, but you end up leaving on a slightly sour note. This hotel is somewhere between a hostel and a hotel and suited us perfectly because of that.

Reviews.Title: “superperfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: gistro73
Reviews.Content: Great hospitality. Very clean, staff polite. Scrumptious breakfast on the rooftop overseeing the Marmara sea. Close to main tourist attractions. The rooms might be a bit small for some, but to me it just looked very cosy. :) It's a shame there isn't a common space to relax in. Overall.........superperfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Very well!”
Reviews.Author: Aurora18
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my son (4 y.o.) for 4 days. Our choice was accidental, I could not find any reviews in Internet, but the room was rather cheap and the children stay free of charge, so we decided to stay here. The location is very good, just 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque. The rooms were very clean, the receptionist and all the service staff were very polite, the meals was wonderful as well. It was possible to book a tour just at the hotel and the guide was excellent. We really fell in love with Istanbul. We'll by all means return to this wonderful city! And we won't have problems with the hotel, for our choice has been already made - only Deniz Konak Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and nice place”
Reviews.Author: ricemaster88
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel at downtown Istanbul. Though the outlook of the building is a bit old, the room is spacious. It was a bit difficult to find on the map and on the street. We called the frontdesk but they couldn't tell the exact location so we have to find it ourselves. Funny though that the first night we arrived they got no electricity and transferred us to a sister hotel nearby. Luckily that they took us there by a car so we do not have to walk with our luggage. In this aspect, they are very considerate. Like other hotel in Instanbul, they got a nice little rooftop where you can have breakfast overseeing the Golden Horn. And there were pigeons around accompany you. One thing must mention was the bed - with marquee using turkish style hand made clothing. We loved it and wanted to bring it home.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: lanulio
Reviews.Content: Excellen location, 5 min. walk from the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. The staff are very friendly! Breakfast is various (in my opinion). We enjoy breakfast on the roof, overlooking the Marmara sea. Cosy rooms but very low ceiling. Some times noisy because of tram but it dosn't make any discomfort for us. Very good price.All of the rooms have cable TV. I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Basic Hotel Located Centrally”
Reviews.Author: GoinWalkabout_G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for what we needed it for--a place to shower, rest our head at night, and eat breakfast in the morning. We were in a small room (my husband if lying on the bed lengthwise could touch both walls), but the bed was fine and there was a little cubby hole for our coats and carry-on suitcases. The shower was fine, however out-dated and in need of renovation. We didn't face the sea so we didn't hear the train at night, but the pre-dawn call to prayers from the nearby mosques were a bit loud. However, in that part of town, you're surrounded by mosques so what can you do? I got used to it by the second morning. Otherwise, it was very quiet. Breakfast was simple Turkish breakfast and nothing fancy, but it sustained us until lunch and gave us a great start to the day. The hotel staff were not overly friendly as in the US, but responded to our questions and requests graciously and would probably have done anything in their power to help if we had a problem. I would recommend this hotel for people who aren't fussy about the size of the room, beds, or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, nice staff, super price”
Reviews.Author: jdanh
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. The free breakfast was a welcoming start to each day with a lot of variety to choose from. Get there early if you want potatoes, those go fast. Like everyone else states it is close by to the Blue Mosque and in a convenient location. The staff was always very friendly and are willing to help out with your needs. The rooms are nice the only problem we had was with the heater in the room not working all the way. Nights were cold as it was around 12-16 degrees Celcius and rainy, however they had plenty of blankets to cover up in. Very satisfied with our stay here and definitely will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “full of the character and charm of the city”
Reviews.Author: LizMDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by friends who had stayed last year, and I'm really glad we accepted their recommendation. I stayed in Room 1 and my friend in Room 2 and both had their own gardens, with swinging chairs and tables and plants etc --- I'd imagine these would be amazing in the summer when the city would be very hot --- and you could see out on to the Bosphorus, with the ships queueing up for the port/docks. The tram passes quite close to the hotel, so it's a bit noisy if you keep the windows open, but I'd prefer to have a tram nearby and put up with any noise than to be miles away. The hotel is very close to Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome and many of the main tourist attractions, and there are many restaurants and cafÃ©s and even pubs nearby. I loved having breakfast (buffet with boiled eggs, sliced cheeses, olives, cucumber, sausages, potatoes in cream, bread, dried fruits etc etc -- and horrid horrid coffee, but there is NescafÃ© in a jar... even though I hate NescafÃ© it was way better than the other) on the terrace within sight of the Blue Mosque and listening to the call to prayer. The staff is really helpful and friendly. The hotel offers a collection from the airport and, while it is more expensive than the many offers you see on the streets in the vicinity, I'd happily pay more when I don't have to lug my suitcase around the uneven streets to the other choices. I felt the service provided was so efficient and so pleasant that I didn't mind in the least paying more than the competition was offering on the streets --- who knows what service these places were providing? I think the beds/mattresses were very uncomfortable, but this may be because I've had a spinal injury and find it difficult to get a comfortable bed. The staff was again very helpful and tried to make things easier by giving me extra pillows etc. I would suggest that the broom cupboard or store-room for the cleaning staff be moved away from the ground-floor bedrooms as there was quite a lot of banging and clattering while staff moved buckets and brooms etc at very early hours of the morning. I would and will recommend this hotel to any of my friends going to Istabul. I'm sure there are more comfortable hotels, but if I were going back to this city, I'd book into the Deniz Konak again and wouldn't even look at other possibilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: swimgirl11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. Five minute walk to the Blue Mosque,and easy to find on foot if you bring a map. Safe neighborhood. Our room was small, but this seems to be the norm abroad and we were quite comfortable. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean. We stayed at four hotels in various cities in Turkey, and this one had our favorite breakfast. A serve-yourself buffet with delicious fresh choices for a nice turkish breakfast. You can eat it out on the terrace with a lovely view. The front desk staff were very helpful in answering our questions. They also offered us tours and shuttles as some of the other reviewers stated, but it did not seem pushy to me. The free wifi was zippy fast, just as for the password at the front desk when you check in. Overall a wonderful experience, definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “An OK place”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaFamily2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, but not nearly as nice as the other one we used in Istanbul. The staff were not all that friendly, and they tried to sell us tours, an airport shuttle (at a higher price than a Taxi!), etc. The room was very small (a double bed, with about 2 feet of space around the be). Breakfast was nothing special, again less variety and quality than the other hotel. We'd stay there again, but only if we couldn't find a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel w/Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: beyahera
Reviews.Content: I and two other female companions stayed in this hotel for a total of 6 nights--3 nights prior to travelling to other parts of Turkey & another 3 nights when we returned back to Istanbul. All our transfers to and from the hotel as well as the rest of our travel itinerary was taken cared of by a very capable tour agency-- Backpackers Travel. The hotel is not sparkling brand new but the beds were clean; double glazed windows kept the noise to a minimum; the aircon worked; and there was lots of hot water (they immediately worked on the leak from the shower so hopefully, this will not be a problem). The hotel is walking distance (10-15 mins) to the Blue Mosque & also the tram that can take one to many parts of Istanbul for Lira 1.5 (one way). We stayed first in room 1 then moved to room 2. Both rooms open to an adjoining garden. THe rooms would do nicely for twin occupancy but it was tight for three persons. We moved things around to get little more room for our luggages. The staff were friendly and accomodating-- the manager, Keram, even helped ordered a turkish dinner to be delivered to our room when we were too tired to go out. Breakfast was served on the top floor (4 flights up-- no elevators) and adequate: boiled eggs, sausages, cream potatoes, two types of bread, assortment of teas, coffee, juice, yoghurt, hotel, several jams, apples & grapes, cereals & dried fruits, some cookies and two types of cakes. Drinking water was always available-- a water dispenser could be found at the entrance. There is a taxi stand close by and several restaurants/cafes could be reached in 10-15 mins walk. There is a small grocery close by for some quick purchases. There are a lot of small side streets and it can be so easy to get lost. What is important is to always have the hotel staff write the name and directions of the hotel in Turkish to show when asking for directions back. It also helps if you get a really good map as the ones given out seem to not show many streets. One thing to remember: a sense of humor goes a long way to enjoy your trip in such an exotic location.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely friendly place just a few minutes from the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Bacall00
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel. It was a really nice and friendly just a short walk from the heart of Sultanahmet, just inside the city walls an with a great view of the Sea of Marmara to one side. The Blue Mosque less than five minutes wall away is a great view from the breakfast terrace on the roof. We had Room 1 which was lovely, ground floor at the back so it was quiet and had it's own small garden. the high wall means the view of the sea is restricted. The hotel backs onto a railway line, but the rooms are all double glazed, and I don't recall any serious noise issues. It is a bit of a hidden gem, but might need polishing a little. the hotel also owns a nearby internet cafe. It isn't perfect, but its faults are forgivable for the atmosphere and location. Be warned if your traveling to it via Taxi it is likely to get lost. Both of ours had difficulty finding it, but that has a lot more to do with the Taxi drivers than the Hotel. If you are serious about seeing Istanbul in all its glory take a very very good street map. Other reviews complain about the breakfast, but to be honest it isn't awful. it is at basic and there is a fair selection to choose from. What isnt good is the Coffee although they thoughtfully provide a jar of Nescafe . Other things that night be improved. Our shower leaked, and flooded the bathroom floor. The rooms were cleaned daily and were always tidy and re stocked with towels etc, but the bathroom was not always cleaned fully. Front of house staff are really lovely, very friendly and very welcoming and will be happy to book side trips and events for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist hotel, close to the action”
Reviews.Author: SydneyPedro
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and were fortunate to have a large room facing the sea (not all rooms are as large). We were very happy with the service, room, free wireless internet and the included breakfast. Its only a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque etc, and it felt like a safe area to be walking day or night. We also used the airport transfer which was convenient and professional (other options may be cheaper but without the flexibility of time and the personalised service). We would stay again at Deniz Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Best price/value hotel around with excellent location and AC”
Reviews.Author: Daean
Reviews.Content: Deniz Konak Hotel is located in a good spot in Sultanahmet district, with less than 20min walk to all the big attractions. The cleaning maid comes every day, there's always somebody in the reception(they take your key away when you leave. A good call. So remember to leave a copy of your passport to your hotel room), the breakfast is a mixture of traditional turkish menu with the mandatory western eggs and sausages. The Air Conditioning in the rooms are a life-saver in the otherwise-hot country. The lobby is filled with free cards about the major tourist attractions and the staff know how to do their jobs, giving you wakeup calls or ordering a taxi downstairs. While the rooms are of the regular size, I found this hotel to be the best in price-value-area. Though the price is cheap, you get an excelllent bargain for your money. I recommend this hotel if you are heading to Hagia Sofia, Top Kapi, the Blue Mosque and the neighbourhooding areas. The restaurants nearby are cheap and good when compared to the more expensive restaurants in the main food district.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CyclistBasel
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, reasonable prices, clean and reliable, but most important: In the middle of the old town with a magnificant view over the Bosporus.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to visit the old istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lieve063
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to come home to after a day of visiting Istanbul , this hotel is the place to be , nice staying and a very friendly and helpful staff , a nice breakfast buffet at the roof of the hotel . Every thing is situated in walking distance of the hotel.thanks again Mr.Kerem,Ekrem and Murife

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: alicepaola
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice and clean. Our room had a wonderful seaside view. At the beginning of our trip in Turkey we stayed in an other hotel but it was aweful (even if the reviews on Tripadvisor were ok) so when we returned in Istanbul at the end of the trip we decided to change. We chose this hotel because a friend recommended us. We payed the same price but Konak was completely different: people were friendly and the room was very confortable.

Reviews.Title: “small inexpensive hotel, ideal location, nice for what it was”
Reviews.Author: ardentripadv
Reviews.Content: Definitely a budget hotel - small and nothing grand, but perfectly functional. TV and aircon and a small roof terrace for breakfast. Room was a bit dated and no view but did the job. Service good, and position just 200m walk slightly uphill to the back of the Blue Mosque - up a nice road. Valuably, you're 20m from a taxi depot and bus-to-airport service (costs 10TL vs 100 or more for a taxi from anywhere to the airport!)

Reviews.Title: “Small comfortable friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: KazakhstanSylvia
Reviews.Content: During our stay in Instanbul the Deniz Konak hotel was perfect for the needs for my wife and myself. The trip was for a little business but mostly pleasure and my company suggested other larger hotels but I preferred a small friendly hotel in the old city. The Deniz Konak hotel was exactly this, a small very friendly hotel with very comfortable rooms, ours had a balcony for no extra cost. It's also convenient for taxis and Metro connections for shopping trips. This was our first trip to Istanbul and definitely not the last and will be booking into the Deniz Konak hotel again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fab City & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AppleTeaAddict
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via TripAdvisor and Turkey Travel Planner. When we booked via email, it was all done within less than an hour! Due to the prompt replies. Initially we booked a twin for 50 Euros a night, a basic room, but when we got there ended up on the 3rd floor with a balcony and beautiful sea view! (great for sitting on in the evening and having a glass of wine and great conversation on) Breakfast was filling and tasty, with it being topped up when needed. The rooms were clean and quite spacious, with a good sized bathroom. The call to Prayer didn't wake us up, as had previous hotels during our stay in Turkey- perhaps due to its secluded location. It is less than a 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and the Hustle and Bustle of Istanbul. Some could see that as a downside, but it was nice to walk through the Bazaar on the side of the Blue Mosque every morning and window shopping on the shops on the route. Airport transfer from the airport (Sabiha Gokcen Airport) to the hotel was helpful and worth spending 45â‚¬ on, however on the way back there are cheaper alternatives, and a Yulme travel agency nearby runs a 10â‚¬ service to Sabiha Gokcen Airport and 5â‚¬ to the western airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location, excellent servive”
Reviews.Author: sinesy
Reviews.Content: Booked airport pick up and car hire through hotel, everything exactly as ordered and promised, had 3 great nights in hotel and Istanbul. Nice clean room, good breakfast and friendly staff. Reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaqueSal
Reviews.Content: We loved Deniz Konak... Comfortable and clean room with a nice sea view, well equipped, delicious homemade breakfast, with a terrace or sea view as a plus... and staff was really kind, caring and always with a smile on their face! If anyone's going to Istanbul, we definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: EssexMorvern
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Deniz Konak this week on a solo holiday to Istanbul. The hotel scores highly for the quiet side-street location (with a handy taxi rank 20m away), close to the Blue Mosque. I was given a double room which, while fine for one, struck me as too small for a couple. With a double bed in place there was no room for so much as a chair in the rest of the room. The hotel is in an old wooden house, so I guess they can't do much about the size of the rooms. The decor was slightly bizarre, with a very rough oatmeal colured concrete over the walls and ceiling with dark flecks in it; it was a bit like sleeping in a bowl of porridge. They also lost big points from me because of the poly-cotton sheets. I can't remember he last time I had to put up with those. Apart from the sheets I had a pleasant stay, though I would probably spend a bit more for a slightly higher standard of comfort if I visit Istanbul again. Staff were friendly and welcoming, and emails and the car transfer from the airport were perfectly managed. The breakfast terrace overlooking the Mosque is terrific (though the breakfast itself was fairly poor).

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CitizenGirl_57
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at its sister hotel, the Sultan's Inn, but our travel agent booked us at the Deniz instead because the Sultan's Inn was booked that night. We stayed for one night and were really glad we did. It was very clean and comfortable. We had a pleasant and spacious room. The room came with a first-aid kit , which was a nice surprise. The staff at the front desk were incredibly nice and helpful and the breakfast buffet was the best we had in Istanbul. Perks: TV, air conditioner, refrigerator (that worked well), and hot water in the shower. We had a nice double bed and our room window looked over the front of the building, which limited the noise. Rooftop tables (a dime a dozen in Istanbul) were breakfast was served were great. Great view of the Sea of Marmara and Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best choice”
Reviews.Author: jgalovich
Reviews.Content: What can I say? We had a lovely room with a patio, view of the sea, the brekakfast was great, the staff very helpful. Good location, somewhat distant from the Sultanahmet craziness but sitll only 10 minutes walk to Aya Sofia, etc. Only downside is Internet access (if you don't have your own laptop) is a good 10 minute walk away, so not too convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & small hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Patrick1971London
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed stayed at the Deniz Konak Hotel in Istanbul in early May for 8 nights. It is conveniently located. Our room overlooked both Marmara Sea and the railway line; the train traffic was sometimes a bit noisy but not excessively so. The hotel staff were very helpful and always smiling, especially Kerem who I conversed with in German and gave me insider tips. The breakfast & restaurant room is on the top floor with a small terrace. The food was nice although every day the same. Both tea and coffee were not very tasty - but this was a minor, negligible detail. Istanbul is a very clean city whose population is very friendly - amazing for such a large city of 12 million people...... Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Turkish touch to a clean and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ortwin
Reviews.Content: Deniz Konak adevrtises as a boutiue hotel, which is indeed the case. All staff is frinedly and helpful, although we have seen many. We had a room with a small garden on the ground floor. It boards the railway track, but all noise is kept outside via the double-glass windows. More noise in the morning from the cleaning lady, whose gear is in the cupboard next door. Breakfast is on the roof terrace. Many choices, mainly Turkish and good taste on average. Rooms are small, but well equipped (free wireless internet) and cleaned every day. Location is close to Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, plus to the tram line. For the boats and busses ou will need to walk upo and down the hill. One disadvantage: resturants in teh area are mediocre to poor.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Rating between 4 and 5 - Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Getgerald
Reviews.Content: I staid there for a weekend May 7 - 10. First of all, I can recommend the taxi service the hotel offers for 20 Euro to go from the airport to the hotel. The hotel, when we arrived was really a pleasant surprise. The staff was extremely helpful. The rate for this hotel is very competitive, also considering that the breakfast was included in the rate. Having said this, I would not to pay a little bit more and get more variety on the breakfast buffet with same fresh fruits and maybe no reheated eggs boiled to cobblestones :-). Room: Had a great spacious room facing the waterside (and the train). Although the windows are very good, you can still hear the train until it stops running which I think is around 11-11:30 PM. But who goes to bed at around 11 in Istanbul ?? Oh, the WLAN was great (and free) Room service forgot my room one day but remedy was immediately done Location : Just great. 10 Minutes walk to the Hagia Sofia and the blue Mosque and another 5 minutes to the Grand Bazar. Therefore the location is just great. Facit: Strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic staff, value, location and service.”
Reviews.Author: sophieLeeds
Reviews.Content: i absolutely loved the stay at this hotel, it was very warm welcoming and comfortable. the hotel itself was very clean the room service was fantastic as well as the breakfast buffet provided. the staff were always available at hand as and when needed. i would like to say special thanks to Meltem who is a recepionist but i have to say she is alot more than that, she went out of her way to help us. i would most definitely come and stay at the hotel again and also reccommend it to any one else wishing to visit Istanbul, the hotel itself is situated in a fantastic area with all facilities and amenities nearby, it is also withing walking distance of the blue mosque, the agia sofiya and all other attractios such as the grand bazar,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Lovely Hotel... we'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Narjice
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a friend and we had a great week staying in this hotel... the staff really looked after us, gave u great advise on what to see and where to go... the room was perfect... with a sea view on one side... the balcony for the kitchen also has a view of the blue mosque which is a very short walk away... if you don't like stairs it might be hard after a long day of siught seeing... we were on the 4th floor with no lift but other wise we had a great holiday and i would recommened the hotel to friends and family... not for people looking for a crazy night life but if you want a sight seeing, relaxing holiday this is perfect :-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money, definitely recommended for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: jr92
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4-night break for two adults in Istanbul from London Luton for just over Â£300 and, with this price, I was frankly expecting a shabby hotel. Whilst our double room in the Deniz Konak was basic, it had an excellent sea view from the balcony and clean bathroom (although to bath was quite small and was only really practical for a shower). Also the bed was perhaps a little hard, yet this did not make our stay unbearable. The reception staff were always extremely welcoming, and did whatever they could to make sure our stay as comfortable and to recommend activities for us in the day. But the greatest thing about the Deniz Konak was the location. A 5-minute walk would bring you to the centre of the historic quarter, to the Blue Mosque and Sultanahmet Square. However, with this ideal location comes the unwelcome fact that the hotel is situated next to the (rather noisy) railway line. Yet on the whole, I would recommend the Deniz Konak simply on the basis that it is brilliant value for money. I especially recommend it for tourists planning to spend a long-weekend city break in Istanbul, people who will plan to spend most of the day out in the city and a comfortable base for the night. 4*

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up! Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: duckpeople
Reviews.Content: Room was small but adequate. Nicely, if not simply, decorated. Hardwood floors, small flat screen tv, small balcony, comfortable beds, clean bathroom. Very nice place and I'd certainly stay again and recommed to other travelers looking for a reasonably-priced, no extra frills hotel. Certainly met all of my needs. Breakfast was decent-- no record breaker (European--no hot foods, coffee left something to be desired) but certainly a fine spread. Staff was friendly. Location was great-- walked to sites all over Sultanahmet. Only note: we propped the window open at night for a little extra air and all of us (three single beds in one room) ended up with mosquito bites in the mornings over the course of three days (not the fault of the hotel, I guess mosquitos just hang out in Istanbul in Dec).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: toorqz
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the money. Great location. Very helpfull and friendly staff. We stayed there for three nights and went to the country side and came back for a night, very late. They gave me the same low rate I had gotten from Hotels.com and they didn't try to rip me off. Breakfast was just ok and could be improved upon. Rooms were small but clean, comfortable and cosy.

Reviews.Title: “fair little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dethman
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel on expedia after reading some reviews on tripadvisor. difficult to find, wandered around the southern part of sultanahmet for a while before finding it tucked away on a little side street. locals were of little help, pointing me in all different directions. front desk staff were hit and miss, some were helpful, some were fairly indifferent and seemed more interested in surfing the internet. checked into a first floor room with a full or queen bed, fair cleanliness and good bathroom with good hot water. internet was free but wifi was not working while i was there, and told to go to their sister hotel to use wifi. location in is good if you can walk up the hill from southern sultanahmet, accessible to all the major sights. comprehensive breakfast on top floor. okay stay at deniz konak.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: traveliz
Reviews.Content: The Deniz Konak Hotel is a small, new budget hotel in the Sultanhamet area. It is an easy walk to all the sights. Our room was small but clean with a nice new bathroom and wonderful hot water. We opted for a budget city view room as we were only staying one night The sea view rooms did appear to be larger and nicer but our room was perfect for our purposes. Breakfast was not as generous as many in Turkey but was adequate and it was warm enough to sit outside and sip coffee or tea and admire the Blue Mosque. All in all, a fine budget hotel. For a longer stay, I would probably suggest one of the sea view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice cozy hotel with friendly price”
Reviews.Author: Shekerim
Reviews.Content: Very nice, small and cozy hotel in Sultanahmet area close to many attractions. Very friendly staff, special thanks to Kerem.Friendly pricing compared to others in the area.We recommend this hotel for Istanbul stayers.Also good shuttle service to AtatÃ¼rk Airport. Heikki Lahti and Esen Devran, Vantaa, Finland

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful, Small Turkish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeraldGNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Having arrived exhausted after a flight from NYC to Istanbul via Amsterdam, it was nice to have an airport transfrer waiting as had been arranged previously with the hotel. My stay at the hotel was delightful. Being greeted by Mr. Benligil, who took my luggage to my room, made my arrival very pleasant. He was very helpful, pleasant and friendly in a variety of ways (getting a taxi, recommending a restaurant, confirming a prearranged tour on the phone, etc.) My room was large, quiet, spotless and overlooking a small quiet street (not the water which was fine with me). An extensive breakfast is served upstairs, either indoors overlooking the water, or on a small patio within sight of the Blue Mosque. It is a small hotel(15 rooms), pleasant and relaxed which gave me the opportunity to talk with people (staff and guests) that a large hotel would not. A possible drawback for some is the lack of an elevator. However, with someone to carry my luggage, even I, tho over 65 didn't mind climbing a flight or two of stairs. The area around the hotel is charming with many small shops and restaurants. I felt perfectly safe walking back alone at 11 pm or midnight. It is only a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque or Hippodrome and perhaps 6 or 7 minutes to the tram. I'd go back in a minute.

HotelInfo.Name: Deniz Houses
HotelInfo.Address: Cayiroglu sok. 14 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
